segment.source: Using CLR 4.0 NGEN PDB Support
segment.target: Using CLR 4.0 NGEN PDB Support

segment.source: Using CLR 4.0 NGEN PDB Support
segment.target: Using CLR 4.0 NGEN PDB Support

segment.source: Using CLR 4.0 NGEN PDB Support
segment.target: Using CLR 4.0 NGEN PDB Support

segment.source: Both Xperf and Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) can run with Common Language Runtime (CLR) 4.0 Native Image Generator (NGEN) PDB support enabled.
segment.target: Both Xperf and Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) can run with Common Language Runtime (CLR) 4.0 Native Image Generator (NGEN) PDB support enabled.

segment.source: Note WPR handles CLR symbols directly, so no flags are necessary when configuring and using NGEN support.
segment.target: Note WPR handles CLR symbols directly, so no flags are necessary when configuring and using NGEN support.

segment.source: When you start a recording in the WPR user interface (UI), NGEN program database files (PDBs) are generated next to the saved recording.
segment.target: When you start a recording in the WPR user interface (UI), NGEN program database files (PDBs) are generated next to the saved recording.

segment.source: These PDBs decode symbols of modules that were created by using NGEN for managed scenarios.
segment.target: These PDBs decode symbols of modules that were created by using NGEN for managed scenarios.

segment.source: For Recording.etl, the NGEN PDBs are in the Recording.etl.NGENPDB folder.
segment.target: For Recording.etl, the NGEN PDBs are in the Recording.etl.NGENPDB folder.

segment.source: Using NGEN support with WPR
segment.target: Using NGEN support with WPR

segment.source: We recommend the following setup before running WPR with NGEN support enabled:
segment.target: We recommend the following setup before running WPR with NGEN support enabled:

segment.source: (Optional, but recommended) Set the SymCache path environment variable to a local directory
segment.target: (Optional, but recommended) Set the SymCache path environment variable to a local directory

segment.source: Transferring a recording that has CLR 4.0 NGEN PDB support enabled
segment.target: Transferring a recording that has CLR 4.0 NGEN PDB support enabled

segment.source: To transfer a recording with CLR 4.0 NGEN PDB support enabled, include the following in the symbol path:
segment.target: To transfer a recording with CLR 4.0 NGEN PDB support enabled, include the following in the symbol path:

segment.source: To transfer the recording to a different computer, make sure that both Recording.etl and the entire folder C:Symbols.NGEN (along with its subfolders) are transferred.
segment.target: To transfer the recording to a different computer, make sure that both Recording.etl and the entire folder C:Symbols.NGEN (along with its subfolders) are transferred.
